channel.title: Harvard HSIL Hackathon | Zhiqiang Huo Profile

item.title: 🚀 Successful Conclusion of the 2025 Harvard HSIL Hackathon – London Hub
item.description:
Successful Conclusion of the 2025 Harvard HSIL Hackathon – London Hub 🎉

I am thrilled to announce the successful conclusion of the 2025 Harvard HSIL Hackathon – London Hub, held on April 11–12! 🇬🇧 Led by Prof. Josip Car and organized by Dr. Lei Lu, the London Hub proudly joined 19 global hubs from 18 countries 🌍 to tackle pressing challenges in healthcare systems.

This year’s theme, “Building High-Value Health Systems: Leveraging Artificial Intelligence”, brought together brilliant minds from academia, healthcare, and industry. Passionate students from prestigious institutions such as Oxford, Cambridge, Edinburgh, and leading London universities like Imperial, UCL, KCL, LSE, LSHTM, Greenwich, and more, participated in this event. 👏

Over two intense days of collaboration and problem-solving, our teams developed innovative AI-driven solutions to address:

  • ❤️ Cardiovascular Disease
  • 🧠 Mental Health Disorders
  • 🤰 Maternal Health
  • 📚 Health Literacy
  • 👩‍⚕️ Workforce Shortages

🌟 Huge Congratulations to Our Winning Teams:

🏆 Adriana Taurinskaite, Prakhar Vats, Vikas Vyas
🏆 Avni Jambholkar, Bharti Devi, Henry Holms, Hyunhee Lee, Joana Teixeira
for their innovative and transformative ideas addressing critical global health challenges! 🙌

Special Thanks 🙏

A heartfelt thank you to our fantastic mentors and judges:

  • Dregan Alexandru
  • Tapabrata Rohan Chakraborty
  • Zhiqiang Huo
  • Mengzhe Xu
  • Lei Lu

Our inspiring speakers:

  • Hayley Ormandy
  • Joseph Casey

Our amazing organizing team:

  • Hanbin Yu
  • Pauline Lee

And to the incredible support from the School of Life Course & Population Sciences and King’s Population Health Institute at King’s College London.

💖 Special thanks to Prof. Rifat Atun, Caroline, Jake, and other dedicated Harvard colleagues for providing this fantastic global platform — nurturing creativity, purpose, and impact-driven innovation in healthcare! 🌐🩺

Looking Forward 🚀

We look forward to continuing our engagement with the Harvard HSIL Hackathon and supporting the global research community by contributing to innovation in healthcare systems through artificial intelligence.
